Oregon coronavirus update, April 9: Oregon reports 6 new COVID-19 deaths, 83 new cases

Woman says Hilliard nursing home admitted her mother without disclosing it had positive COVID-19 case
Licking County has had one person in a nursing home test positive for COVID-19, said Olivia Biggs, Licking County Health Department spokeswoman. She did not say if that person was a resident or an employee, but did say the person had recovered. Reporters John Futty and Bill Bush contributed to this story.

Meanwhile, South Carolina remains roughly two-and-a-half weeks away from the peak of the virus ...

Italy reported 4,204 new cases of the novel coronavirus Thursday and 610 new deaths, suggesting that the virus’s decline may be gradual in the hardest-hit European nation. On Thursday morning, 34 new cases of coronavirus were reported in the South Central Public Health District That includes 13 new cases in Blaine County, bringing the county’s count to 441.

The new coronavirus began spreading in New York weeks before the first confirmed case and came to the area via travelers from Europe, not China, new research suggests. As the nation's top health expert said Thursday that he thinks the U.S. death toll from COVID-19 could be far less than the original White House projection of up to 240,000 lives, President Donald Trump is preparing to form a second coronavirus task force focused on reopening the economy -- while jobless claims soared for the third week in a row.

US reports highest coronavirus death toll in a single day
Despite another day that brought a record number of deaths reported from coronavirus in the United States, there was a glimmer of hope as models now have less dire forecasts for the total number of fatalities the country will see by the time the pandemic subsides. CNN's Nick Watt has the latest.

Coronavirus in Oklahoma: Mobile COVID-19 test sites make adjustments on the fly as state surpasses 1,500 positive tests
The number of Oklahomans who have tested positive for COVID-19 surpassed 1,500 Wednesday — reaching the total just four days after the state Health Department reported the state had reached the 1,000 mark.
